movies.title: The Unicorn
movies.plot: An advertising expert and writer is pushed by his publisher to deliver a script for a new book. This one is supposed to be on the topic sexuality.
movies.simplePlot: An advertising expert and writer is pushed by his publisher to deliver a script for a new book. This one is supposed to be on the topic sexuality.

biography.bio: Peter Vogel was born on March 22, 1937 in Munich, Germany. He was an actor and director, known for Valentin Katajews chirurgische Eingriffe in das Seelenleben des Dr. Igor Igorowitsch (1967), Ein Mann geht durch die Wand (1959) and Kohlhiesel's Daughters (1962). He was married to Gertraud Jesserer. He died on September 21, 1978 in Vienna, Austria.
biography.name: Peter Vogel

biography.placeOfBirth: Trebnitz, Silesia, Germany [now Trzebnica, Dolnoslaskie, Poland]
biography.bio: Gila von Weitershausen was born on March 21, 1944 in Trebnitz, Silesia, Germany as Gisela Freiin von Weitershausen. She is an actress, known for The Country Doctor (1987), Murmur of the Heart (1971) and Die Lümmel von der ersten Bank - 1. Trimester: Zur Hölle mit den Paukern (1968). She has been married to Dr. Hartmut Wahle since 1994. She was previously married to Martin Lüttge.
biography.name: Gila von Weitershausen

biography.placeOfBirth: Schertendorf, Lower Silesia, Germany [now Przylep, Lubuskie, Poland]
biography.bio: Christiane Rücker was born on June 12, 1944 in Schertendorf, Lower Silesia, Germany. She is an actress, known for The Torture Chamber of Dr. Sadism (1967), Bedroom Stewardesses (1968) and Bäng Bäng (1970).
biography.name: Christiane Rücker

biography.bio: Isolde Barth was born on August 24, 1948. She is an actress and production manager, known for The Marriage of Maria Braun (1979), Merci pour le Chocolat (2000) and Kronos. End and Beginning (2008).
biography.name: Isolde Barth

biography.bio: Manfred Böhm was born on September 14, 1930 in Blaubeuren, Baden-Württemberg, Germany. He is an actor, known for Drei Tage im April (1995), Männer ohne Bart (1971) and Hautnah (1985).
biography.name: Manfred Böhm

biography.bio: Hans Helmut Dickow was born on April 14, 1927 in Dresden, Germany. He was an actor, known for Der Prozeß der Jeanne D'Arc zu Rouen 1431 (1967), Umschulung (1969) and Das Projekt Honnef (1977). He died on December 18, 1989 in Stuttgart, Germany.
biography.name: Hans Helmut Dickow

biography.bio: Anton Diffring was a character actor who worked continuously in motion pictures due to his aristocratic, German face and cool, clipped diction, making him ideal for typecasting in British and later American motion pictures as Nazis and other vile, despicable characters. What was ironic about his typecasting as a Nazi is that Diffring, born in Koblenz, Germany, on October 20, 1918, fled Nazi Germany in 1939. He was born into a family that boasted generations of actors, and he studied drama in Berlin and Vienna. At the outbreak of World War II he fled Germany and wound up in Canada, where he was interned as an enemy alien for the duration of the war. It was in Canada where he began his acting career after World War II, working primarily there and in the US before moving to Britain in 1950. He became popular playing Nazis in the postwar period, as the British film industry turned out film after film about the war, which created a great demand for actors who could convincingly play Nazis, the nastier the better. Diffring could play nasty, and his career as a character actor soared. He was still going at it in the 1960s, when he began appearing in American and international co-productions as German soldiers from both WW I and WW II, including The Blue Max (1966), Counterpoint (1967) and that Turner Network Television staple, Where Eagles Dare (1968). He was still going at it in the 1970s and 1980s, as he continued a nearly 40-year-long acting career that was terminated only by his death. He was a much better actor than most of his roles required. Diffring broadened his range as an actor with stage and television work, but the movies continually beckoned, as casting agents were hooked on him when it came to Nazi roles. It was that face that did it; it was both his blessing and his curse. He had the light hair, the piercing blue eyes and the chiseled face of the haughty aristocrat, the German Junker, but it was a face that could telegraph much in the few seconds that was the average shot of a motion picture. As a character actor, he got much done with less (time). In François Truffaut's Fahrenheit 451 (1966) he was cast in all likelihood as a counterpart to the Austrian actor Oskar Werner, so that Werner's own Teutonicness in the English setting wouldn't be as arch. He excelled as Werner's nemesis, as he could create a mood or signal an entire story line with just a look; dialog didn't matter (he likely would have been a superstar in silent films, when it was "the faces" that mattered). Diffring tried to break out of those silken villain roles, moving to Rome in 1968, but producers turned to him again and again to fill their needs for a foreign heavy. He appeared as one of the most infamous Nazis of all, Adolf Hitler's hangman Reinhard Heydrich, in Operation: Daybreak (1975), and as Hitler's foreign minister Joachim von Ribbentrop in the American mini-series The Winds of War (1983). It made him a good living and it made him known, even if it did not fulfill his artistic ambitions. What made his career such a success in terms of its longevity and fecundity was that Diffring was an actor who was enjoyable to watch. From Jack Clayton's I Am a Camera (1955) to Terence Fisher's The Man Who Could Cheat Death (1959), from Samuel Fuller's Tatort: Tote Taube in der Beethovenstraße (1973) to Ken Russell's Valentino (1977), Diffring gave memorable performances, sandwiched in with all the Nazi heavies one career could possibly bear. Anton Diffring died at his home in Chateauneuf-de-Grasse, France, of natural causes on May 20, 1989. He was 70 years old.
biography.name: Anton Diffring

biography.bio: Gerd Eichen was born on February 7, 1925 in Gorsleben, Germany. He was an actor, known for Bottoms Up (1974), Guns of War (1974) and Der Spekulant (1978). He died in October 2007.
biography.name: Gerd Eichen

biography.bio: Helmut Fischer was born on November 15, 1926 in Munich, Germany. He was an actor and director, known for Tatort (1970), Die Hausmeisterin (1987) and Peter und Paul (1992). He was married to Utta Martin. He died on June 14, 1997 in Riedering, Bavaria, Germany.
biography.name: Helmut Fischer

biography.bio: Lutz Hilbert is an actor, known for The Unicorn (1978).
biography.name: Lutz Hilbert

biography.bio: Jochen Jahn is an actor, known for Gold für Montevasall (1968), Spätsommer (1966) and Das Haus (1965).
biography.name: Jochen Jahn

biography.bio: Hannes Kaetner was born on June 25, 1912 in Munich, Bavaria, Germany. He was an actor, known for Lemmi und die Schmöker (1973), The Marriage of Maria Braun (1979) and Almost (1999). He died on October 7, 2002 in Munich.
biography.name: Hannes Kaetner

biography.bio: Elma Karlowa was born on March 12, 1932 in Zagreb, Yugoslavia as Selma-Karolina Karlowac. She was an actress, known for Ali: Fear Eats the Soul (1974), Almenrausch und Edelweiß (1957) and Martha (1974). She died on December 31, 1994 in Munich, Bavaria, Germany.
biography.name: Elma Karlowa

biography.bio: Klaus-Dieter Koenig was born in 1943 in Berlin, Germany. He was an actor, known for Leiche auf Urlaub (1981), The Unicorn (1978) and Strafsache gegen F. (1978). He died on July 15, 2009 in Coburg, Germany.
biography.name: Klaus-Dieter Koenig

biography.bio: Elke Landsknecht is an actress, known for The Unicorn (1978).
biography.name: Elke Landsknecht
